identificationModule.briefTitle: A French Multi-centric Atrial Fibrillation Catheter Ablation Survey
identificationModule.officialTitle: A French Multi-centric Atrial Fibrillation Catheter Ablation Survey

collaborators.name: Hôpital Privé de Parly II - Le Chesnay
University Hospital of Rouen, Rouen, France

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Atrial fibrillation is the most frequent sustained arrhythmia. Catheter ablation is a procedure that is currently used for the treatment of symptomatic atrial fibrillation patients.

We have organized a multi-centric national survey of catheter ablation of atrial fibrillation in order to have a feedback on the type of procedures being performed and the overall results (freedom of atrial fibrillation) over an average follow-up of 18 months.

conditions: Observation of Outcome After Catheter Ablation of Atrial Fibrillation
keywords: atrial fibrillation; catheter ablation; relapse; stroke; death

primaryOutcomes.description: Documentation of atrial fibrillation relapse (symptomatic or asymptomatic) after the first 3 months after the index procedure
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: starting 3 months after the procedure till an average of 18months follow-up

secondaryOutcomes.description: Documented atrial fibrillation relapse (symptomatic or asymptomatic) in the first 3 months after the index procedure

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* all patients undergoing catheter ablation of atrial fibrillation or left atrial flutter

Exclusion Criteria:

* patients undergoing catheter ablation of other types of arrhythmia
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All patients undergoing catheter ablation in one of the registry centers
